aboutProgram: Two-year postdoctoral fellowship training physicians for leadership roles in HIV healthcare.
Founded in 2001 by USC AETC and revitalized in 2016 in partnership with LA County DHS, UCLA NCSP, ViiV Healthcare, and The Lundquist Institute.
Integrated curriculum combining health policy and research coursework with hands-on clinical rotations in HIV and emergency settings.
Year 1 emphasizes foundational courses, community-based research, and core HIV clinics; Year 2 focuses on advanced clinical autonomy, teaching, and completion of a scholar project.
Mission: Develop versatile HIV medicine leaders committed to advocacy and care for underserved populations.
